q:
Determine the correct HTML code that provides the following output:

Output

Options

1.

<style>
.grid {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-rows: repeat(6, 1fr);
  grid-template-columns: repeat(12, 1fr);
  grid-gap: 10px;
}
.box {
  color: white;
  font-size: 4vw;
  padding: 10px;
  background: gold;
  text-align: center;
}
.box:nth-child(1) {
  grid-column: span 12;
  }
.box:nth-child(2), 
.box:nth-child(3) {
  grid-column: span 6;
  }
.box:nth-child(4),
.box:nth-child(5),
.box:nth-child(6) {
  grid-column: span 4;
  }
.box:nth-child(7),
.box:nth-child(8),
.box:nth-child(9),
.box:nth-child(10) {
  grid-column: span 3;
  }
</style>
<main class="grid">
  <div class="box">1</div>
  <div class="box">2</div>
  <div class="box">3</div>
  <div class="box">4</div>
  <div class="box">5</div>
  <div class="box">6</div>
  <div class="box">7</div>
  <div class="box">8</div>
  <div class="box">9</div>
  <div class="box">10</div>
</main>

<style>
.grid {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-rows: repeat(3, 1fr);
  grid-template-columns: repeat(3, 1fr);
  grid-gap: 10px;
}
.box {
  color: white;
  padding: 7px;
  background: purple;
  text-align: center;
}
.box:nth-child(2) {
  grid-column: span 11;
  }
.box:nth-child(3) {
  grid-column: span 2;
  }
.box:nth-child(4) {
  grid-column: span 10;
  }
.box:nth-child(5) {
  grid-column: span 3;
  }
.box:nth-child(6) {
  grid-column: span 9;
  }
</style>

Determine the correct HTML code that provides the following output:

Output:

Options

1.

<style>
  .grid {
    display: block;
    }
  .box {
    color: white;
    font-size: 2vh;
    padding: 10px;
    background: yellowgreen;
    margin: 10px 0;
    text-align: center;
    }
  @media screen and (min-width: 576px) {
    .grid {
      display: grid;
      grid-template-rows: repeat(12, 1fr);
      grid-template-columns: repeat(6, 1fr);
      grid-auto-flow: column;
      grid-gap: 10px;
      }
    .box {
      margin: 0;
      }
    .box:nth-child(1) {
      grid-row: span 12;
      }
    .box:nth-child(2), 
    .box:nth-child(3) {
      grid-row: span 6;
      }
    .box:nth-child(4),
    .box:nth-child(5),
    .box:nth-child(6) {
      grid-row: span 4;
      }
    .box:nth-child(7),
    .box:nth-child(8),
    .box:nth-child(9),
    .box:nth-child(10) {
      grid-row: span 3;
      }
    }
</style>
<main class="grid">
  <div class="box">1</div>
  <div class="box">2</div>
  <div class="box">3</div>
  <div class="box">4</div>
  <div class="box">5</div>
  <div class="box">6</div>
  <div class="box">7</div>
  <div class="box">8</div>
  <div class="box">9</div>
  <div class="box">10</div>

</main>

2.

<style>
  .grid {
    display: block;
    }
  .box {
    color: white;
    font-size: 2vh;
    padding: 10px;
    background: yellowgreen;
    margin: 10px 0;
    text-align: center;
    }
  @media screen and (min-width: 576px) {

      grid-row: span 12;
      }
    .box:nth-child(2) {
      grid-row: span 6;
      }
    .box:nth-child(4) {
      grid-row: span 4;
      }
    .box:nth-child(7) {
      grid-row: span 3;
      }
    }
</style>
<main class="grid">
  <div class="box">1</div>

</main>

  <div class="box">9</div>

In Bootstrap 4, you are working on the grid system. If you are required to construct the grid system for a device that has a small screen, then which of the following statements about the rules of this grid system are correct:
    1. The rows are used to create the vertical groups of the columns.
    2. Content must be placed within the columns and the columns must be immediate children of the rows.
    3. Columns must create the gutter width by using the padding technique.

In Bootstrap 4, you are working on the grid system. You have spanned 6 columns as a fixed-width layout in a small screen-sized device by using the provided class. If you are required to convert your layout to a full-width layout, then which of these statements in this scenario are correct:
    

    .col-sm-6

a.option: The .container class should be converted to the .container-full class.
The .container class should be converted to the .container-fluid class.
The .container class should be converted to the .container-full-width class.
A fixed-width layout cannot be converted to the full-width layout once it is defined for a particular view.

q: In Bootstrap 4, you are working on the grid system. Determine the gutter width of a device that has an extra-large screen.

In Bootstrap 4, you are working on the grid system. If the width of a screen is 1100px, then which of the following devices contains the suitable grid system according to the screen width:
    1. Laptop
    2. Desktop
    3. Tablet
In Bootstrap 4, you are working on the grid system. Which of the following devices has the grid behavior included horizontally in all scenarios?

In Bootstrap 4, you are working on the grid system. Which of the following statements about the grid system classes are correct:
    1. The .col-xs class is used to determine the grid system of an extra-small sized device.
    2. The .col-xl class is used to determine the grid system of an extra-large sized device.
    3. The .col-sm class is used to determine the grid system of a small-sized device.
    4. The .col-md class is used to determine the grid system of a medium-sized device.
